intro: Plectronia campylacantha, commonly known as the broad-leaved plectronia, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Apocynaceae, which includes milkweeds and related species. The plant is characterized by its broad, ovate leaves and clusters of small, tubular flowers that range in color from white to pink. It typically grows in woodland and rocky areas, preferring well-drained soils. Plectronia campylacantha is often cultivated for its ornamental value and is adapted to semi-arid climates.
